intro: Gongronema curtisii, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Gongronema curtisii is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause irritation upon contact with the skin. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
